com.passkeysoft.cardgameserver

Class CardGame<T extends CardPlayer>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.passkeysoft.cardgameserver.CardGame<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - extends CardPlayer. The type of player that will participate in this game.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public abstract class CardGame<T extends CardPlayer>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    An abstract class providing basic functionality for a card game.

    • Field Detail

      • playerList

        public final java.util.List<T extends CardPlayer> playerList
        A list of players participating in this game. player zero is reserved for the deck. Actual players will begin with 1.

      • deck

        protected com.passkeysoft.Deck deck
        The card Deck containing a deck of all the cards used by this game.

      • monitor

        protected final java.lang.Runnable monitor
        A Runnable object that will be used to monitor the play of this game. It is provided by the class instantiating this class, but the Thread containing the monitor will be started by this classes and a Thread reference will be maintained as an instance variable in this instance.

      • gameOver

        protected boolean gameOver

      • currentPlayer

        protected int currentPlayer

      • nextPlayer

        protected int nextPlayer

      • targetPlayer

        protected int targetPlayer

      • isRoundOver

        protected boolean isRoundOver
        A flag indicating whether a round of play for this game is complete. The meaning of a round is dependant on the derived class. In a game like Poker a round could be a round of betting, but in a game like Hearts a round may be when all tricks have been played.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CardGame

        protected CardGame(int timeout,
                   java.lang.Runnable monitor)
        CardGame Constructor. This method is protected, so this object cannot be instantiated directly, it can only be used by derived sub-classes.
        Parameters:
        timeout - How long the run() method will wait before automatically playing for the next player
        monitor - A Runnable object that will be notified when play for the specified player is completed.

    • Method Detail

      • isRoundOver

        public boolean isRoundOver()
        Returns:
        true if the round is over.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public int getCurrentPlayer()
        Returns:
        the index of the current player in the list of players.

      • getNumPlayers

        public int getNumPlayers()
        Returns:
        The number of actual players. It does not count the null player which is the first entry in the player list

      • getNumWithdrawn

        public int getNumWithdrawn()
        Returns:
        The number of players in this game who have withdrawn.

      • setObjectToBePlayed

        public void setObjectToBePlayed(java.lang.Object toBePlayed,
                                int playerIdx,
                                int targetIdx)
        Sets instance values used by the play(java.lang.Object, int, int) method when called from inside the run() method. The contents of these instance values are consumed by the run() method in a different thread, so it is imperative that write access to these instance values by synchronized on this instance.
        Parameters:
        toBePlayed - The object to be played. Typically, in card shedding games or card war games the toBePlayed object is a Card object.
        playerIdx - The index into the player list of the player who is playing
        targetIdx - The index into the player list of the player who is the target of the action (optional).

      • start

        public java.lang.Thread start()
        Create a new Thread that will "Play" this game on behalf of a specified player when notified. It also creates the monitor thread for the monitor object which was furnished in the constructor. If the monitor property is null, no new Threads will be created.
        For details on the behavior of the "Play" thread see the documentation for the run() method.
        Returns:
        A reference to the new monitor thread, or null if no threads were created.

      • restart

        public int restart(int firstPlayer,
                   boolean withDiscard)
        Restarts a round of play. Resets properties to their initial values, resets the owner of all cards in the deck to 0 (the deck) and shuffles it, and sets the state of the round to paused.
        Parameters:
        firstPlayer - The index of the player in the playerList who will be the first to play the new round.
        withDiscard - If true, the first card in the newly shuffled deck will be discarded to start the discard stack.
        Returns:
        The index of the player to start the game.

      • play

        public abstract void play(java.lang.Object objectPlayed,
                          int player,
                          int target)
                   throws IllegalGamePlayException
        Generally, plays a specific card by a specific player. Returns void, so sub-classes are responsible for setting any required return value in a thread-protected instance variable. Typically this method is responsible for setting the "nextPlayer" field so it can be picked up by the monitoring class.
        Parameters:
        objectPlayed - The object to be played. Typically in shedding style card games (e.g. Hearts) or "war" style card games (e.g. Milles Bornes the objectPlayed is an instance of Card.
        player - the index of the player playing the card.
        target - the index of the player who is the target of the play. If the value is 65535 then the card is being discarded. If the value is zero then the target is (typically) ignored.
        Throws:
        IllegalGamePlayException} - thrown when game play cannot be completed for non-Java reasons.
        IllegalGamePlayException

      • getScoreForPlayer

        public abstract int getScoreForPlayer(int playerId)
        Gets the current score for the specified player. This may be a game score or it may be a round score, depending on the needs of the implementation.
        Parameters:
        playerId - The index of the player whose score is being sought.
        Returns:
        The player's score.

      • isPlayable

        protected boolean isPlayable(com.passkeysoft.Card cardPlayed,
                             int player,
                             int target)
        Indicates whether a specific card can be played by a specific player against a specific targeted player. The default implementation simply returns true if the card is in the player's hand, false otherwise
        Parameters:
        cardPlayed - The card intended to be played
        player - The index of the player intending to play the card
        target - The index of the player who is the recipient of the card, if any
        Returns:
        true if the card is playable, false otherwise

      • run

        public void run()
        Started in a new thread, when triggered this method calls the abstract play(Object, int, int) method, which is specific to the derived sub-class. If the trigger is the expiration of the wait timeout, it probably means that the play method should be called as a proxy for a real player who is taking too long. The play(Object, int, int) method will not be called if play is paused. When unPause() is called the timeout will be reset and play will resume. This thread will terminate when gameOver becomes true (and the timeout expires). If timeout is zero when this method is first called the thread will immediately terminate (in those cases where timers are not needed). When this method ends it will also interrupt the monitor thread, if any.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Returns:
        true if the current round is paused, false otherwise.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause the current round.

      • unPause

        public void unPause()
        Unpause the current round. Will have the effect of resetting the play timer so the next player after play resumes will have the full time available.

        public java.lang.String buildHandAsJSON(java.lang.String pathToFaceImage,
